intro: Commersonia kempeana, commonly known as the Kermes tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, often reddish bark. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Commersonia kempeana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
